conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Escalation
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee (SRC) must review safety data before dose escalation from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Dose Interruption
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) elevation criteria for temporary dose interruption.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Discontinuation
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) elevation criteria for permanent study intervention discontinuation.

conditions.name: Neutropenia for Dose Reduction
conditions.description: Neutrophil count decrease criteria for dose reduction.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 50% ↓ from baseline and below reference range

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Clinical evidence of neurologic worsening that may trigger a dose modification evaluation.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Adaptive Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: Condition allowing for the extension of the outpatient period.
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose Escalation to 30mg
transitionRules.text: Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day on Day 1 through Day 28 and then increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29 through Day 39.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT is > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN, temporary interruption of dosing is required.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils > 50% ↓ from baseline and below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Severe ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT is > 5 × ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if Pregnancy or planned pregnancy occurs.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if Use of disallowed medication occurs.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Termination by Sponsor
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Escalation Safety Review
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for the Safety Review Committee to approve dose escalation based on safety data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification for Liver Function
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Unscheduled decision point to modify or discontinue dose based on clinically significant ALT elevations.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic Worsening
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Unscheduled decision point where the Investigator and Medical Monitor evaluate the need for dose modification based on neurologic worsening.
